intro: Aliciella triodon, commonly known as the three-toothed aliciella, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its small, white flowers appear in clusters and are followed by small, dry fruits. Aliciella triodon is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
